problem: Machiavelli added together $1+3i$ and $2-4i$. What number did he get?
solution: Adding together the real part and imaginary parts separately, we have $(1+2)+(3-4)i=\boxed{3-i}$.
chatgpt_solution: Machiavelli combined the real parts of $1 + 3i$ and $2 - 4i$ to get $1 + 2 = \boxed{3}$. He also combined the imaginary parts to get $3 - 4i$. So the number Machiavelli got is $3 + (3 - 4i) = 3 + 3 - 4i = \boxed{6-4i}$.
